messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a flower county with 16 flower fields. The rose field is connected to the sunflower field, tulip field, daisy field, and lily field. The sunflower field is connected to the rose field, tulip field, daisy field, and aster fields. The tulip field is connected to the rose field, sunflower field, daisy field and orchid field. The daisy field is also connected to the rose field, sunflower field, tulip field, and zinnia field. The orchid field is connected to the hydrangea field, lily field, daffodil field, and tulip field. The hydrangea field is connected to the orchid field, lily field, peony field, and marigold field. The lily field is connected to rose field, peony field, hydrangea field, and orchid field. The peony field is also connected to the orchid field, hydrangea field, lily field, and chrysanthemum field. The daffodil field is connected to the chrysanthemum field, carnation field, marigold field, and lavender field. The chrysanthemum field is connected to the daffodil field, carnation field, peony field, and marigold field. The carnation field is connected to the poppy field, daffodil field, marigold field, and chrysanthemum field. The marigold field is also connected to the daffodil field, chrysanthemum field, carnation field, and hydrangea field. The poppy field is connected to the zinnia field, lavender field, aster field, and carnation field. The zinnia field is connected to the daisy field, poppy field, lavender field, and aster field. The lavender field is connected to poppy field, zinnia field, aster field, and daffodil field. The aster field is also connected to the poppy field, zinnia field, lavender field, and sunflower field. You have been told that you can get a bunch of 50 chrysanthemum flowers for free if you visit the chrysanthemum field and you can get a bunch of 10 lavender flowers for free if you choose to visit the lavender field. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from rose, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

To find the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers starting from the rose field, we will use Dijkstra's algorithm. 

Step 1: Create a table to keep track of the shortest distance and previous node for each field. Initialize the distance of the starting node (rose field) to 0 and the distances of all other nodes to infinity.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| Infinity           | None
Tulip    | Infinity           | None
Daisy    | Infinity           | None
Lily     | Infinity           | None
Orchid   | Infinity           | None
Hydrangea| Infinity           | None
Peony    | Infinity           | None
Daffodil | Infinity           | None
Chrysanthemum| Infinity       | None
Carnation| Infinity           | None
Marigold | Infinity           | None
Poppy    | Infinity           | None
Zinnia   | Infinity           | None
Lavender | Infinity           | None
Aster    | Infinity           | None

Step 2: Initialize a set of unvisited nodes and add all the fields to it.

Unvisited nodes: Rose, Sunflower, Tulip, Daisy, Lily, Orchid, Hydrangea, Peony, Daffodil, Chrysanthemum, Carnation, Marigold, Poppy, Zinnia, Lavender, Aster

Step 3: While there are still unvisited nodes, choose the node with the minimum distance and mark it as visited.

- The node with the minimum distance is Rose. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Sunflower, Tulip, Daisy, and Lily.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     | 1                  | Rose
Orchid   | Infinity           | None
Hydrangea| Infinity           | None
Peony    | Infinity           | None
Daffodil | Infinity           | None
Chrysanthemum| Infinity       | None
Carnation| Infinity           | None
Marigold | Infinity           | None
Poppy    | Infinity           | None
Zinnia   | Infinity           | None
Lavender | Infinity           | None
Aster    | Infinity           | None

Step 4: Repeat Step 3 until all nodes have been visited.

- The node with the minimum distance is Sunflower. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Rose, Tulip, Daisy, and Aster.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     | 1                  | Rose
Orchid   | Infinity           | None
Hydrangea| Infinity           | None
Peony    | Infinity           | None
Daffodil | Infinity           | None
Chrysanthemum| Infinity       | None
Carnation| Infinity           | None
Marigold | Infinity           | None
Poppy    | Infinity           | None
Zinnia   | Infinity           | None
Lavender | Infinity           | None
Aster    | 2                  | Sunflower

- The node with the minimum distance is Tulip. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Rose, Sunflower, Daisy, and Orchid.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     | 1                  | Rose
Orchid   | 2                  | Tulip
Hydrangea| Infinity           | None
Peony    | Infinity           | None
Daffodil | Infinity           | None
Chrysanthemum| Infinity       | None
Carnation| Infinity           | None
Marigold | Infinity           | None
Poppy    | Infinity           | None
Zinnia   | Infinity           | None
Lavender | Infinity           | None
Aster    | 2                  | Sunflower

- The node with the minimum distance is Daisy. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Rose, Sunflower, Tulip, and Zinnia.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     |

Now you have been told that the sunflower field is no longer connected to the aster field and, instead, the sunflower field is now connected to the marigold field. Also, the hydrangea field is no longer connected to the marigold field and, instead, the hydrangea field is now connected to the aster field. Also, the daisy field is no longer connected to the zinnia field and, instead, the daisy field is now connected to the lily field. The path from the rose field to the lily field is blocked. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from rose, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

To find the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers starting from the rose field, we will use Dijkstra's algorithm.

Step 2: Initialize a set of unvisited nodes and add all the fields to it.

Unvisited nodes: Rose, Sunflower, Tulip, Daisy, Lily, Orchid, Hydrangea, Peony, Daffodil, Chrysanthemum, Carnation, Marigold, Poppy, Zinnia, Lavender, Aster

Step 3: While there are still unvisited nodes, choose the node with the minimum distance and mark it as visited.

- The node with the minimum distance is Rose. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Sunflower, Tulip, and Daisy.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     | Infinity           | None

Aster    | Infinity           | None

Step 4: Repeat Step 3 until all nodes have been visited.

- The node with the minimum distance is Sunflower. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Rose, Tulip, Marigold, and Aster.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     | Infinity           | None
Orchid   | Infinity           | None
Hydrangea| Infinity           | None

Daffodil | Infinity           | None

Marigold | 2                  | Sunflower

Lavender | Infinity           | None
Aster    | Infinity           | None

- The node with the minimum distance is Tulip. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Rose, Sunflower, and Orchid.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     | Infinity           | None
Orchid   | 2                  | Tulip
Hydrangea| Infinity           | None
Peony    | Infinity           | None
Daffodil | Infinity           | None
Chrysanthemum| Infinity       | None
Carnation| Infinity           | None

- The node with the minimum distance is Daisy. Update the distances of its neighboring nodes: Rose and Lily.

Field    | Distance from Rose | Previous Node
----------------------------------------------
Rose     | 0                  | None
Sunflower| 1                  | Rose
Tulip    | 1                  | Rose
Daisy    | 1                  | Rose
Lily     | 2                  | Daisy
Orchid   | 2
